section.title: How far will a (*-1C A) test scan?
section.para: The CG-2 spec dictates that for a test (*-1C A): "There is a cohort to the left containing a reading which has a tag belonging to the set A. The first such cohort must have a tag belonging to the set A in all its readings." ...meaning scanning stops at the first A regardless of whether it is carefully A. To scan further than the first A you must use **.
VISLCG2 was not compliant with that and would scan until it found a "careful A". This caused the need for ugly hacks such as (*1C A BARRIER A) to emulate the correct behavior.

section.title: How can I match the tag * from my input?
section.para: You can't. The single * symbol is reserved for many special meanings in CG-3. I suggest replacing it with ** or <*> or anything that isn't a single * if you need to work with it in CG.
